title: Clean up WIP commit for duplicate PR filtering
description: The WIP commit in the from-here branch needs to be cleaned up. Interactive rebase to give it a nicer commit subject. Current subject: 'wip add tests for duplicate commits'

title: Warn when pushing a stack that will abandon PRs
description: Issue a warning when you're about to push a stack that will abandon PRs.

title: Handle automerge clone timeouts
description: Currently automerge clones a new working copy from the remote. I've observed this taking a long time and by default no output is printed. We should use a coroutine to run this in a different context and we should log a message every 5 seconds that is something like "Cloning is taking a long time, press CTRL-C to cancel"

title: Overhaul clean behavior
description: I want `git jaspr clean` to behave more like a wizard. It should display a list of all branches it would remove based on current settings. The information should be broken into three groups: orphaned branches, empty named stack branches, and abandoned branches (see CleanPlan in the code for an explanation of these). Then it should prompt the user (using Clikt's prompt option) to clean the displayed branches, change one of the option flags, or abort. The option flags should be booleans and are the following: clean abanoned PRs (default true), clean just my PRs (default true).

title: Review autoMerge behavior when entire stack is not mergeable
description: Review autoMerge's behavior when the entire stack is not mergeable. Current thought: want it to wait until everything specified is mergeable before merging anything. The normal merge command will merge as much as it can. Should also consider if that's really the right thing to do, instead of failing if the entire specified stack cannot be merged as a whole.

title: Overhaul CLI to use options instead of arguments
description: Move away from trying to mimic `git`'s CLI and support options for everything.

title: Add man page for git-jaspr, generated from AsciiDoc via Gradle
description:
Add a man page (git-jaspr.1) so that `git jaspr --help` works when installed via Homebrew.

Approach:
- Write the man page source as an AsciiDoc file (e.g. git-jaspr.1.adoc) using AsciiDoc's manpage doctype
- Use the org.asciidoctor.jvm.convert Gradle plugin with the manpage backend to generate the roff man page
- Include the generated man page as a build artifact alongside the native binary
- The Homebrew formula (git-jaspr-x4j) will install it via man1.install

This avoids external tool dependencies (runs on the JVM) and doesn't depend on the native image being built first.

Blocked by: nothing
Blocks: git-jaspr-x4j (Homebrew formula should install the man page)

title: Show only error message to user, log stack trace to log file
description: When errors like IllegalArgumentException are thrown during startup (e.g. from determineGithubInfo at Cli.kt:424), the full stack trace is dumped to the console. This is ugly and unhelpful for users. Instead, only the error message should be shown on the console (stderr), while the full stack trace should continue to be logged to the detailed log file that jaspr already writes. This likely requires changes to logback.xml to configure different logging behavior for console vs file appenders (e.g. console appender suppresses stack traces while file appender retains them). May also require catching these errors earlier in the Cli.kt run() method — currently determineGithubInfo is called during lazy init of appWiring (line 392), which means the IllegalArgumentException bypasses the existing try/catch in run() that handles GitJasprException.

title: Improve error message when GitHub info cannot be inferred from remote URI
description: When extractGitHubInfoFromUri returns null (Cli.kt:424), the error message says 'Couldn't infer github info from <remote> URI: <uri>' but doesn't tell the user how to fix it. Update the message to mention the --github-host, --repo-owner, and --repo-name options from the GitHubOptions option group so the user knows they can specify these manually.

title: Run GitJasprFunctionalExternalProcessTest to update GraalVM native image metadata
description: Before cutting a new release, need to run GitJasprFunctionalExternalProcessTest to update the GraalVM native image metadata files.

title: Work around potential issues in CI/CD workflows caused by changing target branches
description:
When part of a stack is merged and a PR's base ref is updated, re-triggered workflow actions may reference stale environment variables (e.g. GITHUB_BASE_REF still pointing to a deleted jaspr branch). This can cause actions like block-fixup-merge-action to fail.

Potential fix: when retargeting a PR, rewrite the stack (no code changes, just bump the commit date) and do a new push, so that workflows are triggered fresh with correct base ref values.

External ref: https://github.com/MichaelSims/git-jaspr/issues/294

description:
Investigate and fix why Dependabot's pull requests are not passing checks.

External ref: https://github.com/MichaelSims/git-jaspr/issues/31

title: Add command to checkout existing named stack with selection UI
description: Add a jaspr command to checkout an existing named stack with an easy UI to select one from those that exist.

title: Add shell completion script for git-jaspr to Homebrew formula
description:
Add a shell completion script to the Homebrew formula/artifact so that git-jaspr supports tab completion in bash (and ideally zsh/fish). The completion should work when invoked as both 'git-jaspr' and 'git jaspr' (as a git subcommand).

Reference implementation: /opt/homebrew/Cellar/git/2.51.2/share/bash-completion/completions/git — study how git's own completion script works, especially how it handles subcommands, to understand the patterns for registering completions.

This will likely involve:
- Generating or writing a completion script that understands git-jaspr's subcommands and options (Clikt may have built-in support for generating completions)
- Installing the completion script to the appropriate location via the Homebrew formula (e.g. bash_completion/zsh_completion dirs)
- Ensuring the completion works for both invocation styles (standalone 'git-jaspr' and git subcommand 'git jaspr')
- The 'git jaspr' form may require integration with git's own completion system (e.g. a _git_jaspr function that git's completion framework discovers automatically)

Note: This is largely unexplored territory — will need research into how bash/zsh completion works, how git discovers subcommand completions, and whether Clikt offers completion generation.

title: Post-merge branch deletion closes PRs that target deleted branches
description: Bug that happens post-merge where jaspr deletes branches that it just merged. If there is an existing PR that targets one of those branches, that PR is implicitly closed by GitHub, which is bad. Jaspr should not delete any branches that are the base ref for any jaspr PRs.

Update the GitHub Actions publish workflow to publish the distTar artifact alongside the native image.

description: GitJasprTest.kt has grown very large. Break it up into smaller, focused test files organized by feature area (e.g., merge tests, push tests, stack management tests). Each file should still implement the GitJasprTest interface but focus on a specific area of functionality.

title: Improve stack name autogeneration based on commit subject
description: Change the way stack names are autogenerated. Want the name to be based off the commit subject. Some sort of natural language processing would be amazing, but barring that, some extraction from the words in the subject. The exact approach is TBD.

title: Support deploying a Homebrew formula to a tap repository
description:
Add support for deploying git-jaspr as a Homebrew formula to https://github.com/MichaelSims/homebrew-tap (using a different formula name than the previous 'spr' formula that was deployed there).

Background: The predecessor project (a Go fork of 'spr') used goreleaser/goreleaser-action@v2 with a .goreleaser.yml to build, release, and deploy a Homebrew formula. We want equivalent functionality here but implemented directly rather than through goreleaser.

Key considerations:
- Implement the brew formula deployment logic (what goreleaser does) as part of this project's CI/CD, likely as a GitHub Action workflow
- GitHub repo configuration will be needed so that an action in the git-jaspr repo can push commits to the homebrew-tap repo (e.g. a PAT or deploy key with write access to the tap repo)
- Architecture handling is an open question: this project uses GraalVM native-image to produce native binaries. It's unclear whether native-image produces architecture-specific binaries or a single binary that relies on a translation layer (e.g. Rosetta on macOS). This needs investigation before designing the formula — goreleaser handled multi-arch (amd64/arm64) natively since Go cross-compiles, but native-image may behave differently
- The formula should handle downloading the correct artifact, verifying checksums, and installing the binary

title: Rebase development branch commit onto from-here and run tests
description: There's a single commit at the end of the development branch that needs to be rebased onto from-here and the tests ran again. The tests for multiple PRs per branch will likely fail since that commit changes how PRs are retrieved.
